Articles.Content:
Can't say much because I'm using my tablet right now.

I've known him for 16 years all my life and all of the sudden he's gone

Sorry to hear that Daniel, I hope he went peacefully

is that him in your avatar?
Lived longer than my dog(14yr) or my other cat(3yrs ran over On a road with roadblocks on both sides somehow)Really hard to say anything through a text-based medium without sounding like your aunt.

Sorry to hear that Daniel, I hope he went peacefully

is that him in your avatar?

Unfortunately it isn't And it appears to have been a heart attack.

- - - Updated - - -

Long will you be missed.
Sorry for your loss. Nothing is as sad as losing someone who is close to you, doesn't matter if it's a pet or a human.

Sorry for your loss. Nothing is as sad as losing someone who is close to you, doesn't matter if it's a pet or a human.

Ikr nothing will replace him. but I may soon visit a local shelter it may help but it will never replace.
Sorry, Daniel. My cat died in January though. She was ~15.

Sorry, Daniel. My cat died in January though. She was ~15.

Thanks friend i really appreciate you guys's support, I hope to adopt another furry sometime. But whoever that home needing kitty is will still not replace a good friend who liked to nibble at my toes like a little fish
I have a ten year old cat, I feel very bad for you. Cats can not be replaced. I hope a new one will help though.

I'm so sorry. Cats are closer than most people think.

May your buddy R.I.P

My 18 year old passed away memorial day last year. I still get chocked up when I think about it. Even had her cremated. So sorry for your loss.

We've since got a new kitten and yes it does help fill the void.
I am so sorry. R.I.P. daniel l.'s cat.
I am so very sorry for your loss... I have 4 rescue cats, and they're like family for me, too.

I am so very sorry for your loss... I have 4 rescue cats, and they're like family for me, too.

Me too But i am intending to get a rescue kitten.

I had a loss a few years back, with a pet rabbit that had to be put down after 6 months of having it, due to him having severe pains, so i can feel for your loss.

Sorry for your loss, RIP daniels cat.

I had a loss a few years back, with a pet rabbit that had to be put down after 6 months of having it, due to him having severe pains, so i can feel for your loss.

Sorry for your loss, RIP daniels cat.

Sorry for your rabbit.

Sorry to hear that. I lost my own furry buddy back in March, it royally sucks.

Having a cat for half your life and then have them taken away from you can be heartbreaking.

*internet hug*

Sorry to hear that. I lost my own furry buddy back in March, it royally sucks.

Having a cat for half your life and then have them taken away from you can be heartbreaking.

*internet hug*

thank you for the *hug

There there.

I know how you feel. I'm not even that old and I've had lots of pets die on me. And no, not because I'm a bad owner. We humans just tend to live longer than dogs and parakeets xP

Did you discover or witness her death? I know from experience that can be the most disturbing part.

There there.

I know how you feel. I'm not even that old and I've had lots of pets die on me. And no, not because I'm a bad owner. We humans just tend to live longer than dogs and parakeets xP

Did you discover or witness her death? I know from experience that can be the most disturbing part.

My mom discovered his death. But the most disturbing part was that he just layed there. Looking like he had just collapsed in the middle of something. And it was worse how his eyes were still open. it feels like your looking at a creepy puppet only worse

My cat of 7 years passed away a year and a half ago, and then my dog of 14 years passed away almost exactly a year ago.

In high school my cat would always cuddle up next to me on my bed while I played video games, so I keep a picture of him next to my gaming PC.

There were times growing up with my dog(A big black German Shepard/black lab mix) we would be on the couch, and he would turn around to watch a squirrel in the yard, and so I would watch the squirrel with him. He drooled a lot looking at those squirrels haha

Cherish the memories. You will always have a space in your heart for your pets, they loved you just as much as you loved them.

Take care Daniel, I know it can be rough.
Any cat's death diminishes me, because I am involved in catkind, and therefore never send to know for whom the bell tolls; it tolls for thee.

I had a cat die last year. Her name was ' Possum, and was truly more than a pet. She was a dear friend and a part of the family. I understand and can relate to your loss. May your heart cherish the fond memories of your four pawed friend...

sorry for your loss, I know the feeling of loss, I had a cat, it was almost a year old, but something happened to him, when I left home the cat was a little weird, when I returned the cat was feeling very bad. after 2 days he died .

I'm very sorry to hear that. I've had to deal with the loss of a cat, and in the past five years, the loss of two dogs. One of the dogs lived to be only four years old, which was too young in my opinion. He definitely lived a happy life, though.
